main event: Three different UFO sightings were reported in the Pacific region in 1951.
interesting points: One sighting described an object as dark and cylindrical with a short tail, resembling a rocket in controlled flight. It disappeared at a 4-degree elevation.
Another sighting reported a cylindrical object with internal illumination observed from a distance of approximately 7.5 miles, moving at a speed of 1500 to 2000 knots.

A pilot of a USAF aircraft reported a circular, grayish object with a greenish-blue glow, about 4-5 times the size of a B-29 bomber, remaining stationary for 1 minute before rapidly climbing and disappearing.
The pilot's sighting was considered credible due to his experience and reliability as a witness.
The report included references to intelligence officers and was classified as controlled intelligence material.
sighted object: cylindrical and circular-shaped objects with unusual lights and movements
witnesses: pilots, Lt. D. H. SILL, USN, and a USAF pilot
